thread.title: Local chatty parakeet featured on TV
thread.title_full: Local chatty parakeet featured on TV

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Local chatty parakeet featured on TV
text:
Rochester’s favorite talking parakeet is back, this time joining other household pets on a national television special. Disco the parakeet, owned by the Bolton family of Penfield, started exercising his voice after the family brought him home from a local pet store. Soon, the bird had about 400 words under his wing, plus an adoring fan base on social media.
The Boltons and their avian chatterbox were filmed for a BBC documentary called “Pets – Wild at Heart” last year, which looks at the natural animal behaviors pets exhibit while living among their human counterparts.
PBS’s Nature will air the documentary at 8 p.m. Wednesday on WXXI-TV, digital channel 21.1 and Time Warner Cable channels 11 and 1221.
Disco’s segment explores how parakeets chatter for social company because of their natural tendency to gather and communicate in large flocks in the wild.
Pet parakeets sometimes bond with their human family as their “flock,” and end up mimicking human sounds and voices.
Follow Disco’s future antics on Facebook , Twitter and Youtube .
STADDEO@Gannett.com
Disco Day at Birds Unlimited
What: Disco the parakeet makes a return engagement to Birds Unlimited for a Meet and Greet.
Where: Birds Unlimited, 1421 Empire Blvd., Webster.
When: Saturday, Oct. 24, noon to 3 p.m.
ROCHESTER DEMOCRAT AND CHRONICLE
Chatty local parakeet a social media star
